summary: Comprehensive verification of 15 data points. All claims verified. Key updates: nationwide expansion (50 states), lending volume $1.5B (was $439M), employees ~103 (was 110), category corrected from bank to funder (nonprofit CDFI). Added 2 new leaders.

claims.notes: Renamed to LiftFund in 2015 after leaving U.S. Accion network in late 2014
Now nationwide (50 states) as of 2025. 15 states only for SBA 7(a) Community Advantage
Now 28,000+ business owners funded, ~$1.5B total capital deployed
Confirmed in multiple sources including OFN Ned Gramlich Award citation
~103 as of Oct 2025 per LeadIQ. Fluctuates 100-115
Appointed after Laurie Vignaud departed June 30, 2024 (less than 1 year tenure)

claims.claim: Hereford: attorney, Trinity University (Phi Beta Kappa), UT Austin Law JD
Barrera: founder, former nun, Corpus Christi native
claims.notes: Nun for 15 years (1973-~1988). Parents owned La Mexicana restaurant

claims.claim: Barrera: University of the Incarnate Word
Barrera: Obama advisory council, Ned Gramlich Award
claims.notes: Obama Financial Capability Council (2011). Ned Gramlich Lifetime Award (2022). Also: Treasury Advisory Committee on Racial Equity
$10M gift in December 2020, helped reduce interest rates to 9%
From OFN at OFN41, October 22, 2025, Washington D.C.

claims.claim: CDFI Friendly Fort Worth 0% interest loan program
claims.notes: Up to $100K. Partnership with CDFI Friendly Fort Worth (independent nonprofit). LiftFund deployed $7M+ in similar interest-free loans in Texas
2025 deployment. Lifetime: $222M+ to 11,000+ businesses, sustaining ~47,000 jobs

leaders.name: Sara Saldana
leaders.title: Chief Lending Officer
leaders.notes: At LiftFund since April 2010. No LinkedIn found

newFindings.barreraPostLiftFund: Now CEO of Kirpa Tech (AI website builder for small businesses). Board member at Piermont Bank. Joined San Antonio Report Board.
loanProducts: SBA 7(a) Community Advantage: up to SBA limits, Prime WSJ + up to 6%, 7-10 years
SBA 504 Loan: for fixed assets/real estate
newFindings.categoryCorrection: Was 'bank', corrected to 'funder'. LiftFund is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit CDFI, not a bank (no deposits, not FDIC-insured, no bank charter)
